trans-unit.source: Using the FTP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the FTP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the FTP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the FTP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Connect to an FTP server to move data or files.
trans-unit.target: Connect to an FTP server to move data or files.

trans-unit.source: Key features of the FTP connector include:
trans-unit.target: Key features of the FTP connector include:

trans-unit.source: Pulling files from the FTP server on demand
trans-unit.target: Pulling files from the FTP server on demand

trans-unit.source: Running polls based on a configurable schedule
trans-unit.target: Running polls based on a configurable schedule

trans-unit.source: Polling the FTP server and triggering the logic flow based on new documents in the FTP Server
trans-unit.target: Polling the FTP server and triggering the logic flow based on new documents in the FTP Server

trans-unit.source: Specifying the FTP server as an IP address, port, password, and host name
trans-unit.target: Specifying the FTP server as an IP address, port, password, and host name

trans-unit.source: Ability to run sends on demand
trans-unit.target: Ability to run sends on demand

trans-unit.source: Ability to delete files on FTP Server on demand
trans-unit.target: Ability to delete files on FTP Server on demand

trans-unit.source: You can add the FTP connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the FTP connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To create a new FTP connector, follow the steps mentioned below.
trans-unit.target: To create a new FTP connector, follow the steps mentioned below.

trans-unit.source: Launch Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Launch Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Open Azure marketplace using +New (at the bottom of the page) -> Web+Mobile --> Azure Marketplace: <linkText>Launch Azure Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Open Azure marketplace using +New (at the bottom of the page) -> Web+Mobile --> Azure Marketplace: <linkText>Launch Azure Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on API Apps
trans-unit.target: Click on API Apps

trans-unit.source: Search for FTP, and select FTP Connector: <linkText>Select FTP Connector</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Search for FTP, and select FTP Connector: <linkText>Select FTP Connector</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on Create
trans-unit.target: Click on Create

trans-unit.source: In the FTP connector blade that opens up, provide the following data: <linkText>Create FTP Connector</linkText>
trans-unit.target: In the FTP connector blade that opens up, provide the following data: <linkText>Create FTP Connector</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Location - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: Location - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: Subscription - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: Subscription - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: Resource group - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: Resource group - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: Web hosting plan - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: Web hosting plan - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: Pricing tier - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: Name - give a name for your FTP Connector
trans-unit.target: Name - give a name for your FTP Connector

trans-unit.source: Package settings
trans-unit.target: Package settings

trans-unit.source: Server Address - Specify the FTP Server name or IP address
trans-unit.target: Server Address - Specify the FTP Server name or IP address

trans-unit.source: User Name - Specify the user name to connect to the FTP Server
trans-unit.target: User Name - Specify the user name to connect to the FTP Server

trans-unit.source: Password - Specify the password to connect to the FTP Server
trans-unit.target: Password - Specify the password to connect to the FTP Server

trans-unit.source: Root Folder - Specify a root folder path
trans-unit.target: Root Folder - Specify a root folder path

trans-unit.source: Use Binary - Specify true to use Binary transfer mode, false for ASCII
trans-unit.target: Use Binary - Specify true to use Binary transfer mode, false for ASCII

trans-unit.source: Use SSL - Specify true to use FTP over a secure SSL/TLS channel
trans-unit.target: Use SSL - Specify true to use FTP over a secure SSL/TLS channel

trans-unit.source: Server Port - Specify the FTP Server port number
trans-unit.target: Server Port - Specify the FTP Server port number

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new FTP Connector will be created.
trans-unit.target: A new FTP Connector will be created.

trans-unit.source: Once the FTP connector has been created, it can be consumed from the flow.
trans-unit.target: Once the FTP connector has been created, it can be consumed from the flow.

trans-unit.source: Create a new flow through +New -> Web+Mobile -> LogicApp.
trans-unit.target: Create a new flow through +New -> Web+Mobile -> LogicApp.

trans-unit.source: Provide the metadata for the flow including resource group: <linkText>Create Logic App</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Provide the metadata for the flow including resource group: <linkText>Create Logic App</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on triggers and actions.
trans-unit.target: Click on triggers and actions.

trans-unit.source: The flow designer opens: <linkText>Logic App empty flow designer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: The flow designer opens: <linkText>Logic App empty flow designer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: FTP Connector can be used as both trigger and action.
trans-unit.target: FTP Connector can be used as both trigger and action.

trans-unit.source: In the empty flow designer, click on FTP connector from the right gallery pane: <linkText>Choose FTP Trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: In the empty flow designer, click on FTP connector from the right gallery pane: <linkText>Choose FTP Trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: FTP Connector has one trigger - 'File Available (Read then Delete)'.
trans-unit.target: FTP Connector has one trigger - 'File Available (Read then Delete)'.

trans-unit.source: This trigger:
trans-unit.target: This trigger:

trans-unit.source: Polls the folder path for new files
trans-unit.target: Polls the folder path for new files

trans-unit.source: Instantiates the logic flow whenever for every new file
trans-unit.target: Instantiates the logic flow whenever for every new file

trans-unit.source: Deletes the file from the folder path after the logic flow has been instantiated
trans-unit.target: Deletes the file from the folder path after the logic flow has been instantiated

trans-unit.source: Click on 'File Available (Read then Delete)' trigger: <linkText>Basic inputs FTP Trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on 'File Available (Read then Delete)' trigger: <linkText>Basic inputs FTP Trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The inputs help you configure a particular folder path to be polled on a scheduled frequency.
trans-unit.target: The inputs help you configure a particular folder path to be polled on a scheduled frequency.

trans-unit.source: The basic inputs are
trans-unit.target: The basic inputs are

trans-unit.source: Frequency - Specifies the frequency of the FTP poll
trans-unit.target: Frequency - Specifies the frequency of the FTP poll

trans-unit.source: Interval - Specifies the interval for the scheduled frequency
trans-unit.target: Interval - Specifies the interval for the scheduled frequency

trans-unit.source: Folder Path - Specifies the folder path in the FTP Server
trans-unit.target: Folder Path - Specifies the folder path in the FTP Server

trans-unit.source: Type of file - Specifies whether the file type is text or binary
trans-unit.target: Type of file - Specifies whether the file type is text or binary

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the elipses '...' shows the advanced inputs: <linkText>Basic inputs FTP Trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the elipses '...' shows the advanced inputs: <linkText>Basic inputs FTP Trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The advanced inputs include:
trans-unit.target: The advanced inputs include:

trans-unit.source: File mask - Specifies the file mask while polling
trans-unit.target: File mask - Specifies the file mask while polling

trans-unit.source: Exclude file mask - Specifies the file masks to exclude while polling
trans-unit.target: Exclude file mask - Specifies the file masks to exclude while polling

trans-unit.source: Provide the inputs and click on the check mark to complete input configuration: <linkText>Basic inputs FTP Trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Provide the inputs and click on the check mark to complete input configuration: <linkText>Basic inputs FTP Trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that the configured FTP trigger shows both input parameters configured as well as the outputs.
trans-unit.target: Note that the configured FTP trigger shows both input parameters configured as well as the outputs.

trans-unit.source: The output of FTP Connector can be used as the input of some other actions in the flow.
trans-unit.target: The output of FTP Connector can be used as the input of some other actions in the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can click on '...' in the input dialog of action and select the output of FTP from the drop down box directly.
trans-unit.target: You can click on '...' in the input dialog of action and select the output of FTP from the drop down box directly.

trans-unit.source: You can also write an expression directly in the input box of action.
trans-unit.target: You can also write an expression directly in the input box of action.

trans-unit.source: The flow expression to refer to the output of ftp trigger is given below:
trans-unit.target: The flow expression to refer to the output of ftp trigger is given below:

trans-unit.source: Click on FTP connector from the right pane.
trans-unit.target: Click on FTP connector from the right pane.

trans-unit.source: The FTP connector lists down the actions supported: <linkText>List of FTP Actions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: The FTP connector lists down the actions supported: <linkText>List of FTP Actions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: FTP Connector supports the following actions:
trans-unit.target: FTP Connector supports the following actions:

trans-unit.source: Get File - Get the contents of a specific file
trans-unit.target: Get File - Get the contents of a specific file

trans-unit.source: Upload File - Uploads file to the FTP folder path
trans-unit.target: Upload File - Uploads file to the FTP folder path

trans-unit.source: Delete File - Deletes file from the FTP folder path
trans-unit.target: Delete File - Deletes file from the FTP folder path

trans-unit.source: List Files - Lists all the files in the FTP folder path
trans-unit.target: List Files - Lists all the files in the FTP folder path

trans-unit.source: Lets take one example - Upload File.
trans-unit.target: Lets take one example - Upload File.

trans-unit.source: Click on Upload File.
trans-unit.target: Click on Upload File.

trans-unit.source: The basic inputs are displayed first: <linkText>Basic inputs of Upload File action</linkText>
trans-unit.target: The basic inputs are displayed first: <linkText>Basic inputs of Upload File action</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Content - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: Content - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: Content Transfer Encoding - Specify none or base64
trans-unit.target: Content Transfer Encoding - Specify none or base64

trans-unit.source: File Path - Specifies the file path of the file to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: File Path - Specifies the file path of the file to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: Click on ... for advanced inputs: <linkText>Basic inputs of Upload File action</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on ... for advanced inputs: <linkText>Basic inputs of Upload File action</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Append If Exists - True or False 'Append If Exist'.
trans-unit.target: Append If Exists - True or False 'Append If Exist'.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, the data is appended to the file if it exists.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, the data is appended to the file if it exists.

trans-unit.source: When disabled, the file is overwritten if it exists
trans-unit.target: When disabled, the file is overwritten if it exists

trans-unit.source: Temporary Folder - Optional.
trans-unit.target: Temporary Folder - Optional.

trans-unit.source: If provided, the adapter will upload the file to the 'Temporary Folder Path' and once the upload is done the file will be moved to 'Folder Path'.
trans-unit.target: If provided, the adapter will upload the file to the 'Temporary Folder Path' and once the upload is done the file will be moved to 'Folder Path'.

trans-unit.source: The 'Temporary Folder Path' should be on the same physical disk as the 'Folder Path' to make sure that the move operation is atomic.
trans-unit.target: The 'Temporary Folder Path' should be on the same physical disk as the 'Folder Path' to make sure that the move operation is atomic.

trans-unit.source: Temporary folder can be used only when 'Append If Exist' property is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Temporary folder can be used only when 'Append If Exist' property is disabled.

trans-unit.source: Provide the inputs and click on the check mark to complete input configuration: <linkText>Configured Upload File action</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Provide the inputs and click on the check mark to complete input configuration: <linkText>Configured Upload File action</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The 'File Path' parameter is set to:
trans-unit.target: The 'File Path' parameter is set to:

trans-unit.source: Note that the configured FTP Upload File action shows both input parameters as well as output parameters.
trans-unit.target: Note that the configured FTP Upload File action shows both input parameters as well as output parameters.

trans-unit.source: Note that in the configured screenshot, Content is value is set to an expression.
trans-unit.target: Note that in the configured screenshot, Content is value is set to an expression.

trans-unit.source: You can set it to any value that you want.
trans-unit.target: You can set it to any value that you want.

trans-unit.source: This is just an example.
trans-unit.target: This is just an example.

trans-unit.source: The expression takes the output of the logic app trigger and uses it as the content of the file to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: The expression takes the output of the logic app trigger and uses it as the content of the file to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Lets say you want to use the output of a previous action, say transform.
trans-unit.target: Lets say you want to use the output of a previous action, say transform.

trans-unit.source: In that case, the expression would be
trans-unit.target: In that case, the expression would be

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
